item.title: [GROOVY-11328] Groovy 4.0.19 - Unable to start (picocli)
item.description:

comments.comment: This issue looks platform-specific (Mac) Both Intel and Arm Macs are affected. Only tested sdkman distribution. Linux seems to be unaffected
Just tried downloading from the website. Still doesn't work.
Thanks for that lprimak. We have had a previous informal report of the glitch. We will likely plan for a new release soon once we have confirmed the issue and made a fix.

With Groovy 4.0.18 this works fine.

This is an unexpected impact when moving to the latest Gradle. The workaround is to remove the groovy-raw jar from the installation. It isn't meant to be there but our previously working build steps for removing it seem to no longer work. As mentioned earlier, it doesn't impact all platforms. Maybe on Windows (not affected) the groovy jar is on the classpath before the raw jar but not for Linux.
We'll probably do another release in the next week or two which will fix this. In the meantime, consider removing the erroneous groovy-raw jar from your distribution.
I can confirm that removing groovy-raw.jar from the distribution fixed the problem for me. Thank you!
